As of November 2005, only stage3 installations are officially supported.<ref>[http://www.gentoo.org/news/en/gwn/20051114-newsletter.xml Gentoo Linux Newsletter - November 14th, 2005<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Although [[tarball]]s for stage1 and stage2 are still distributed, the instructions for installing from these stages have been removed from the handbook<ref>[http://article.gmane.org/gmane.linux.gentoo.documentation/2327 Gmane - Mail To News And Back Again<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and put into the Gentoo FAQ.
As of November 2005, only stage3 installations are officially supported.<ref>[http://www.gentoo.org/news/en/gwn/20051114-newsletter.xml Gentoo Linux Newsletter - November 14th, 2005<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Although [[tarball]]s for stage1 and stage2 are still distributed, the instructions for installing from these stages have been removed from the handbook<ref>[http://article.gmane.org/gmane.linux.gentoo.documentation/2327 Gmane - Mail To News And Back Again<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and put into the Gentoo FAQ.
  +   +
===Live USB===
  +
A Live USB of Gentoo Linux can be created manually or with [[UNetbootin]] <ref>[http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/]</ref>.
